summary: Adds a Sustenance skill into Skyrim along with its own perks and perk tree. Takes up one of the skill tree slots created by Skyrim Custom Skills main file. Now also compatible with Merged Thievery Skill. A standalone SkyRe Wayfarer integration version is also available.
descriptionHtml:
[b][font=Georgia][color=#ff7700][size=3]DESCRIPTION[/size][/color][/font][/b]
This mod adds an Sustenance skill to Skyrim along with perks and its own perk tree. Although not technically dependant on it, this file REQUIRES the main [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56249/?]SCS - Skyrim Custom Skills[/url] files to work. [color=#e06666]Please visit the Main files's page for details about the mod's mechanics and installation instructions. All versions of this skill also require "[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26228/?]Realistic Needs and Diseases[/url]" by perseid9![/color]

As of version 2.0, there is also a Lockpicking version which uses the perk tree slot created by "[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/21792/?]Merged Thievery Skill[/url]" by LukeH. This version is "standalone" and does NOT need the main SCS file to work. Just download it and make sure it is loaded AFTER the Merged Thievery Skill mod in your load order.

As requested by some, I have also included another standalone version which integrates some of my Sustenance perks into SkyRe's Wayfarer perk tree. Not all of them are included because there is a limited number of nodes a perk tree can handle. This version requires SkyRe_Main.esp and SkyRe_Survivalism.esp so it needs to be loaded after both of them in your load order. 

[b][font=Georgia][color=#ff7700][size=3]IMPORTANT UPDATE NOTE[/size][/color][/font][/b]
If updating to version 2.0 from an older version, make sure you ALSO update to version 2.0 of the Main file - bad things will happen otherwise...

[b][font=Georgia][color=#ff7700][size=3]ABOUT SUSTENANCE[/size][/color][/font][/b]
Primary needs are a much sought for feature in TES/Fallout games. Unlike New Vegas, Skyrim doesn't manage basic needs by itself but with an almost limitless modding potential it isn't really a problem. However, I have always felt primary needs should be more integrated into the main game via a skill and improve over time (much like Survavilism is somewhat tied to the primary needs in FNV). 
My favourite needs mod is "Realistic Needs and Diseases" by perseid9 (http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26228/?). (I know many players are shifting towards iNeed recently but I am way too satisfied and familiar with RND features and functionality to do that myself just yet.) This mod requires you to have RND installed as it depends on it. It disables some settings in the RND MCM menu - instead, you get more user-friendly values by taking relevant perks. This skill is raised by eating and drinking (but not when you are already full), cooking and eating homecooked meals. 

[b][font=Georgia][color=#ff7700][size=3]PERKS[/size][/color][/font][/b]
Indefatigability
Requires: Sustenance 0/30/60
It takes slightly/moderately/much longer for you to get tired.

Digestion
Requires: Sustenance 15/45/75, Runner
It takes slightly/moderately/much longer for you to get hungry.

Mushroom Enthusiast
Requires: Sustenance 50, Digestion
While sneaking, you can eat mushrooms to reduce your hunger.

Strong Stomach
Requires: Sustenance 75, Mushroom Enthusiast
You can eat stale and raw food without any penalties.

Cannibal
Requires: Sustenance 80, Strong Stomach
You can feast on humanoid corpses.

Hydration
Requires: Sustenance 30/60/90, Indefatigability
It takes slightly/moderately/much longer for you to get thirsty.

Rain Dance
Requires: Sustenance 40/80, Hydration
You can decrease your thirst by drinking raindrops while it is raining./ You also gain the power to summon rain once a day.

Sea Creature
Requires: Sustenance 60, Rain Dance
Bottled seawater now decreases your thirst and doesn't cause any harmuful secondary effects.  

Alcoholic
Requires: Sustenance 40, Hydration
You suffer reduced side effects from drinking alcohol.

Liquid Bread
Requires: Sustenance 50, Alcoholic
Drinking common alcoholic drinks reduces your hunger.

Rest And Meditate
Requires: Sustenance 20/40/60/80/100, Indefatigability
You should rest and meditate on what you have learned. Sleep after choosing this perk, to receive 3 perk points for each rank of this perk for which you haven't already received them.

Healthy Sleep
Requires: Sustenance 50, Rest And Meditate
Being diseased doesn't prevent you from normal resting.

Sleep Anywhere
Requires: Sustenance 100, Healthy Sleep
No more looking for empty beds! You gain the ability to sleep on the ground.

Preserver
Requires: Sustenance 35, Digestion
Proper preserving prevents food from getting spoiled.

Religiousness
Requires: Sustenance 60, Preserver
Praying at a Divine's Altar will cure diseases.

MilkDrinker
Requires: Sustenance 45, Hydration
You can turn buckets into milk buckets at a tanning rack and use them to milk cows while crouched.


[b][font=Georgia][color=#ff7700][size=3]CREDITS[/size][/color][/font][/b]
Bethesda - for Skyrim and Creation Kit!
The TES5Edit team - for TES5Edit, most of SCS was created with this sweet tool!
Mator - for Automation Tools for TES5Edit, I could never have worked with skill trees the way I did without the script provided there!
author: DavidTheFalcon

files.name: SCS-Sustenance (Alteration Slot)
files.changelogHtml:
Added Preserver, Milk Drinker and Religiousness perks. (All should have been part of the initial release.)
Added a version compatible with Merged Thievery Skill.
Added a standalone version taht integrates Sustenance into the SkyRe Wayfarer perk tree.
